name: Fish Applique Pattern
description:
**This is a PDF pattern. Please specify the email address you would like the pattern sent to in the note to seller or I will send to your paypal email address.**

The fish measures approx. 2 inches from head to tail but can vary based on yarn and hook size.

The applique are great for scrapbooking, hair clips, hats, pins and many other crafts.

The pattern is suitable for beginners and only uses very basic stitches. You will need to know how to make an adjustable ring, single crochet, double crochet and slip stitch.

There are several pictures in this pattern to help those who need to see examples. I am a visual learner and just have to see it sometimes to understand. If you have any questions about the pattern, you can always email me.

Feel free to sell items you make with this pattern I just ask that you provide a link back to my site-www.creatingeverlaughter.com

name: Oliver and Olivia Owl Applique Pattern
description:
**This is for a PDF pattern. Please specify the email address you would like the pattern sent to in the message to seller or I will send to your paypal email address.**

Meet Oliver and his little sister, Olivia!

These cute little owls are great for scrapbooking, hair clips, hats, pins and many other crafts.

Size will vary by yarn and hook size.

Using worsted weight:
G hook – 2 ¼ by 2 ½ inches. 
I hook – 2 ¾ by 3 inches.

The pattern is suitable for advanced beginners to intermediate and uses the following stitches. You will need to know how to an adjustable ring, single crochet, single crochet decrease, double crochet, half double crochet, and slip stitch.

As with all of my patterns, there are several detailed pictures in this pattern to help those who need to see examples. I am a visual learner and just have to see it sometimes to understand. If you have any questions about the pattern, you can always email me.

My patterns are copyright protected, but you are welcome to sell items you make from them. I do ask that you credit me with a link to my site: www.creatingeverlaughter.com

“Laugh as much as you breathe and love as long as you live.”

name: Bird Applique
description:
**This is a PDF pattern. Please specify the email address you would like the pattern sent to in the note to seller or I will send to your paypal email address.** 

The bird measures approx. 2 ½ inches across from head to tail but can vary based on yarn and hook size.

The applique are great for scrapbooking, hair clips, hats, pins and many other crafts.

The pattern is suitable for advanced beginners and only uses basic stitches. You will need to know how to make an adjustable ring, single crochet, half double crochet, double crochet, treble crochet, and slip stitch. Videos for how to do adjustable rings can be found on youtube.

There are several detailed pictures in this pattern to help those who need to see examples. I am a visual learner and just have to see it sometimes to understand. If you have any questions about the pattern, you can always email me.

My patterns are copyright protected, but you are welcome to sell items you make from them. I do ask that you credit me with a link to my site: www.creatingeverlaughter.com

name: Skull and Crossbones Applique Pattern
description:
**This is a PDF pattern. Please specify the email address you would like the pattern sent to in the note to seller or I will send to your paypal email address.** 

Using worsted weight yarn and size H hook the finished sizes are:

Skull: 2 ¼ inches across and 2 ½ inches tall. Bone: 3 ½ inches long.

The applique are great for Halloween scrapbooking, hair clips, hats, pins and many other crafts.

The patterns are ranked easy to intermediate and use the following stitches: single crochet, half double crochet, double crochet, and slip stitch. You will need to know how to make an adjutstable ring or magic loop.

There are several detailed pictures in this pattern to help those who need to see examples. I am a visual learner and just have to see it sometimes to understand. If you have any questions about the pattern, you can always email me.

My patterns are copyright protected, but you are welcome to sell items you make from them. I do ask that you credit me with a link to my site: www.creatingeverlaughter.com

Be sure to check my profile for any promotions I may have available!

“Laugh as much as you breathe and love as long as you live.”
